page.title: 04THE PUBLIC LIBRARY
page.content: THE LIBRARY From 1888 until 1975 the library was situated on Station Rd. Although that building is still there, the new library was opened in Lancaster Rd in 1975.The new library offers reference and lending services for children and adults,a sound recording loan service, a tourist information centre, and a photocopier. The citizens advice bureau also operates in the building. The Plessey computerised issue system was introduced in 1978 being the first public library in Leicestershire to go live.All the books in Leicestershire libraries are catalogued on microfiche and can be ordered in Hinckley. There are about 80 000 volumes in Hinckley, of which about 20 000 are on loan at one time.
